byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Donald J Trump argues that United States must wage unrelenting ideological fight to defeat Islamic State during speech at Youngstown State University in Ohio, critical swing state where polls show him trailing Hillary Clinton; renews call to bar anyone from parts of world where terrorism breeds from entering US.

headline.print_headline: Trump Invokes Cold War in Plan to Fight Terror
headline.main: Donald Trump’s Terrorism Plan Mixes Cold War Concepts and Limits on Immigrants

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Mr. Trump, in a foreign policy address, called for “extreme vetting” of prospective new arrivals that would include an “ideological test.”...
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, in a foreign policy address, called for “extreme vetting” of prospective new arrivals that would include an “ideological test.”
